data.title: Cathedral
data.text: Was able to attend mass at this beautiful place of worship. Very well maintained and beautiful example of local architectural history.

data.title: Beautiful Building
data.text: The Cathedral is very beautiful and full of history. Many other places to see nearby. It is a great picture opportunity/

data.title: The oldest active Christian building in the States
data.text: In downtown San Antonio, in the core of the Plaza, the Cathedral encompasses the 18th century, the Independence of Texas, the Alamo and the embrace of the city to its different immigrant cultures and diverse population. When the border was moved, a large part of its original citizens remained and fought for a new and better Texas. The Canary Island descendants, the Alamo heroes and the new Sanantonians, all have their place in this very interesting building. The oldest part, dating from the New Spain of the 18c., corresponds to the main altar and the dome. The original Spanish building was enlarged and renewed in the 19th c. following the Neo-Gothic architectural design, with a subtle French influence and characteristic windows. History and Faith go hand in hand here.

data.title: Light show was super
data.text: This was one of the nicest and most memorable city trips I have had recently because of this light show. It is truly a work of art and was the highlight of my trip!

data.title: Amazing design
data.text:
Located in the center of downtown San Antonio.  The Cathedral has many statues and paintings that are very beautiful to look at.  Enter the building and immediately feel the presense of a higher being. If ever in SA do not
pass up on this historical church.

data.title: Beautiful - go and see.
data.text: We went here a couple of times.  First for the laser/light show saga one night.  Then we also went during the day to go inside the cathedral and it is so beautiful! The crypt at the front door of the heros of the Alamo is significant for local history.

data.title: Breath Taking ! Spectacular!
data.text: This was an awesome stop on our tour. Pope John Paul came to San Fernando to perform mass. Beautiful building and fantastic alter area

data.title: Unexpected...
data.text:
First, don't miss the light show projected onto the Cathedral.  Check the San Antonio tourism website for days, but in November the 20 minute show is at 9, 9:30 and 10 pm on Tuesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  The plaza in front draws a crowd.
There is a crypt in the entrance to the cathedral holding the remains of those who fought at the Alamo.  Don't miss this great part of Texas history.

data.title: Beautiful inside and out.
data.text: The Cathedral is open to the public. It's a short walk from Riverwalk. One of the most beautiful churches I have seen.

data.title: MUST SEE LASER SHOW
data.text: This is pretty neat! The cathedral is close to the Riverwalk. I love churches, so I make it a point to go to one wherever I travel to. Interesting thing about this cathedral is it turns to a laser show at night. A 5-minute history of San Antonio  is projected to the facade of the cathedral with some background music. I encourage people with kids visiting San Antonio to put this on their must-see list.

data.title: A must see Cathedral
data.text: Always visit this cathedral when in San Antonio.  It is a place that everyone should see while in San Antonio. Can walk to it from the river walk.

data.title: Awesome Laser Show
data.text: Check the schedule for when the laser show takes place.  Lasers are projected onto the cathedral in a 20 minute long presentation on the history of Texas.  Nice soundtrack included.  This was a very unique and fun experience.

data.title: Beautiful and inspiring
data.text: Visited here, it's a stop on the Hop On Hop Off bus. Don't pass it up, regardless of your beliefs. Read the old tomb markers. The remains of some of the Alamo heroes are interred here.

data.title: SEE THE LIGHT SHOW
data.text: Don't miss the free light show projected on to the building.  It's amazing!  We weren't going to stop here, but so glad we did.  I've never seen anything like this before.

data.title: Absolutely do not miss the light show!
data.text: This cathedral is gorgeous from an architectural standpoint, but I have to say the modern twist of a Lazer show presented on its face makes it even more spectacular! We stayed at the Westin, and walked down a couple blocks and there it was. It is a historical look at San Antonio using a unique medium of a church building and a Lazer show! I absolutely was blown away by the superior quality of the production!

data.title: Stunning night light show !
data.text: OMG. This is a must see at night. We stubbled upon it after dinner walking through the main plaza. A beautiful light show displayed on the outside of the cathedral, depicting the history of san Antonio.  Amazing!

data.title: It is a beautiful church renovated a few years ago in the heart of downtown San Antonio,
data.text:
The original church was built between 1738 and 1750 which gives the claim as the oldest cathedral in the Texas, 
The style is Colonial Gothic Revival, the architect was Francois Giraud is register as U. S.  National Register of Historic Places is the mother church of the Archdiocese of San Antonio and the seat of the archbishop.
The cathedral was built by settlers from the Canary Islands for this reason the interior has a picture from the
Virgen of Candelaria patron of the Islands.

data.title: Really enjoyed "The Saga"
data.text: Touring the interior of this chapel was very limited due to a memorial service scheduled at the church the morning we stopped by, but it is beautiful inside and out, and the laser show we saw there ("The Saga") which is limited to certain evenings was thoroughly enjoyable. See it if you can because it's to end in 2017 I believe.

data.title: Cool!
data.text: This is an absolutely beautiful church and if you can find out when they are doing the light show that is definitely something not to be missed. You don't need to arrive early there are lots of spots for standing or sitting in the courtyard in front of the church. The show itself is very unique and combines history light and film. Seeing the cathedral during the day is also worth it as there's so much history here.

data.title: Be sure to see the light show
data.text: We loved the history and beautiful of this historic cathedral.  We sure to see the memorial to the Alamo defender.  On Tuesday, Friday and Saturday evening be sure to watch the history of the city displayed in a wonderful light show.
